sub_topic: Calculation of thermal conductivity in a solid material
message_1: What is the thermal conductivity of a silicon crystal at 300 K if the lattice thermal conductivity is 130 W/mK and the electronic thermal conductivity is 70 W/mK? Assume that the contribution of phonons and electrons to the thermal conductivity is independent of each other.
message_2:
To find the total thermal conductivity of the silicon crystal at 300 K, we can simply add the lattice thermal conductivity and the electronic thermal conductivity, since their contributions are independent of each other.

Total thermal conductivity (k_total) = Lattice thermal conductivity (k_lattice) + Electronic thermal conductivity (k_electronic)

k_total = 130 W/mK + 70 W/mK = 200 W/mK

The thermal conductivity of the silicon crystal at 300 K is 200 W/mK.
